newsitem.title: USA: Cisco to offer high speed modem.
newsitem.headline: Cisco to offer high speed modem.

text.p: Cisco Systems Inc said it plans to integrate high-speed 56 Kilobits per second (Kbps) modem technology into its current and future dial access product line.
In a statement issued Wednesday, Cisco said its AS5200 customers will be the first to benefit from high-speed 56Kbps modem technology.

Cisco said it will incorporate technology from both Lucent Technologies Inc and Rockwell International Corp's Rockwell Semiconductor Systems in the development and delivery of an interoperable 56Kbps modem technology.
The move is a blow to U.S. Robotics Corp, which offers a competing form of technology.
Cisco said it plans to integrate 56Kbps modem technology into the Cisco AS5200 universal access server in the first half of 1997.
U.S. Robotics was off 2-3/8 to 69-7/8. Cisco was off 1/16 to 73-5/8 and Rockwell was up 1/4 to 63-3/4.
